before.title: Structural Assessment
before.description: Evaluate building safety in seismic zones
steps: Get buildings assessed by structural engineers
Retrofit old buildings with seismic upgrades
Identify safe spots in each room (under tables, doorways)
Secure heavy furniture and appliances to walls

before.title: Emergency Preparedness
steps: Develop family emergency communication plan
Practice drop, cover, and hold on drills
Keep emergency kit accessible
Know evacuation routes from buildings

during.title: Drop, Cover, Hold On
steps: Drop to hands and knees immediately
Take cover under sturdy desk or table
Hold on and protect head and neck
Stay in position until shaking stops

during.title: If Outside
steps: Move away from buildings, trees, power lines
Get to open ground if possible
If in mountains, watch for landslides
Stay where you are until shaking stops

after.title: Immediate Assessment
steps: Check yourself and others for injuries
Look for gas leaks, electrical damage, structural damage
Use stairs, never elevators
Be prepared for aftershocks

after.title: Mountain-Specific Precautions
steps: Watch for landslides and rockfalls
Avoid rivers that may be blocked
Check mountain roads for damage
Contact rescue services if trapped
